message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CY, cs.SI 

This paper deals with natural language processing and machine learning techniques to classify fake news and satire. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). The paper also uses state-of-the-art contextual language models, which falls under the category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of machine learning methods for classification makes cs.LG (Machine Learning) another likely category. The paper also discusses the nuances between fake news and satire, which could be related to social and political aspects, making cs.CY (Computers and Society) a possible category. Finally, the paper uses linguistic features based on textual coherence metrics, which could fall under the category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks).
